page.title: 12EDUCATION AT SANDHEAD
page.content: by Gavin Jakeman aged 11 Sandhead School is quite a small school but I think it is a very good one. We have 6 classrooms, a Remedial Room, an Art Room, a staffroom, and an office. We have only 4 teachers in our school and so, of the two spare rooms, one is used as a Library/Computer Room and the other as an Audio/Visual Room. In the Computer Room we have 6 Sinclair Spectrum computers which we hope to Interface and Microdrive next session. We use the A/V Room for watching TV programmes - both live and recorded; for looking at slides; and for producing plays for our Puppet Theatre. The school playing field is 1 kilometre away, down in the village. Visitors to the beach use the field in the summer and the goalmouth gets all rough and holed, which is very bad for goalkeepers like myself.
